BR_text.BRsummary: KF1.0: No GPU Vendors Listed In UI (GCP)
BR_text.BRdescription:
/kind bug
 Here's a screen shot of the Jupyter UI in a 1.0 cluster
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/dd24e6e>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/dd24e6e</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/777219/73849282-86e9c300-47de-11ea-96d3-f138269e7a3a.png></denchmark-link>
 
 No vendors are listed in the GPU window.
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>
  do the GPU vendors need to be listed in a configmap?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
  yes, I made a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/798>PR</denchmark-link>
  to manifests to resolve this one but I'm having some problems with the tests.

comments_4.comment_text: Before we close this is issue I would like to ensure that on GCP a GPU node gets properly provisioned and the pod assigned.

comments_5.comment_text:
Confirmed this is working.
 
 Using the new UI I was able to attach a GPU
 NAP automatically created a GPU node pool
 I verified I could import tensorflow and see the GPU
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/129b889>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/129b889</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/4163109/pod.txt>pod.txt</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/777219/73903982-7160b180-484f-11ea-8eed-a0f0ac7ccdf3.png></denchmark-link>
